intro: Ada ocanensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, with upright stems and clustered foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Ada ocanensis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
